message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.IR, cs.HC 

This paper deals with the problem of food image recognition, which is a subfield of computer vision (cs.CV). The paper proposes a personalized classifier, which involves adapting to the user's domain incrementally using a very limited number of samples, which is a problem of machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also mentions the use of a food-logging application, which falls under the category of mobile computing (cs.MM). The paper also discusses the limitations of a single classifier common to all users, which is a problem of information retrieval (cs.IR). Finally, the paper proposes a framework for personalization, which involves understanding user behavior and preferences, which is a problem of human-computer interaction (cs.HC).
